snippet: In a letter leaked to a Frankfurt newspaper, the German central bank warns about the risks of lending to banks that would fail without the cheap money.
abstract: German Bundesbank, in a letter leaked to a Frankfurt newspaper, warns about the risks of lending to banks that would fail without access to cheap money; controversy comes into the open after European Central Bank lent 529.5 billion euros ($705 billion) to 800 banks for three years, the second big cash infusion in two months.
lead_paragraph: In a letter leaked to a Frankfurt newspaper, the German central bank warns about the risks of lending to banks that would fail without the cheap money.

headline.main: Bundesbank Fears Risks in European Central Bank Lending Policy
